alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Fayette; Greene; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 4:18PM EDT until May 06 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Central Ohio, South Central Ohio, Southwest Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Central Ohio, Fayette OH. In South Central Ohio, Ross. In Southwest Ohio, Clinton and Warren. In West Central Ohio, Greene. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 416 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area, especially in areas which received heavy rainfall earlier this morning. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen thus far today. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in parts of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mason, Lebanon, Washington Court House, Wilmington, Monroe, Blanchester, Sabina, Morrow, New Holland, Kings Island, Highpoint, South Lebanon, Staunton, Good Hope, Frankfort, Maineville, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Martinsville and Clarksburg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
